00023 int SOCK_init( SOCKCTX *ctx , int verbose, int flags)
00024 {
00025   unsigned int arg;
00026   struct linger l;
00027 
00028   ctx->verbose = verbose;
00029   ctx->connected = 0;
00030 
00031   ctx->addr = 0;
00032   ctx->addr_size = 0;
00033 
00034   ctx->fd = socket( PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0 );
00035   if (ctx->fd == -1) {
00036      if (ctx->verbose) {
00037        fprintf(stderr, "Failed to create socket %d\n", errno);
00038      }
00039      return -1;
00040   }
00041 
00042   arg = 0;
00043   if (ioctl( ctx->fd, FIONBIO, &arg ) ) {
00044      if (ctx->verbose) {
00045        fprintf(stderr, "Failed to make socket non blocking errno %d\n", errno);
00046      }
00047   }
00048 
00049   if ((flags & SOCKCTX_FLAGS_NAGLE_ON) == 0) {  
00050     arg = 1;
00051     if (setsockopt( ctx->fd, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, &arg, sizeof(arg) ) ) {
00052        if (ctx->verbose) {
00053          fprintf(stderr,"Failed to set nodelay option (disable nagle algorithm failed). errno %d\n",errno);
00054        }    
00055     }
00056   }
00057 
00058   ctx->close_on_peer_close = 1; 
00059   if (flags & SOCKTCX_FLAGS_DONT_CLOSE_ON_PEER_CLOSE) {
00060     l.l_onoff = 1; l.l_linger = LINGER_OPTION_VALUE;
00061     if (setsockopt( ctx->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_LINGER, &l, sizeof(struct linger) )) {
00062       if (ctx->verbose) {
00063        fprintf(stderr,"Failed to set linger option. %d\n", errno );
00064       }
00065     }
00066     ctx->close_on_peer_close = 0; 
00067   }
00068 
00069   return 0;
00070 }

00073 int SOCK_send_buffer_sizes( SOCKCTX *ctx, int read_buffer_size, int write_buffer_size)
00074 {
00075   int val;
00076   if (read_buffer_size > 0) {
00077     val = read_buffer_size;
00078     if (setsockopt( ctx->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, &val, sizeof(val) )) {
00079       fprintf(stderr,"Failed to set receive buffer size to %d\n",val);
00080       return -1;
00081     }
00082   }
00083   
00084   if (write_buffer_size > 0) {
00085     val = write_buffer_size;
00086     if (setsockopt( ctx->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, &val, sizeof(val) )) {
00087       fprintf(stderr,"Failed to set send buffer size to %d\n",val);
00088       return -1;
00089     }
00090   }
00091   return 0;  
00092 
00093 }

00096 int SOCK_connect( SOCKCTX *ctx, void *addr, int addr_size, int connect_timeout)
00097 {
00098   int rt;
00099   fd_set wset,eset;
00100   struct timeval tv;
00101   int error = 0;
00102   int len;
00103     
00104   if (ctx->connected) {
00105     return 0;
00106   }
00107 
00108   if (addr != 0) {
00109      ctx->addr = malloc( addr_size );
00110      if (!ctx->addr) {
00111        goto err;
00112      }
00113      memcpy( ctx->addr, addr, addr_size );
00114      ctx->addr_size = addr_size;
00115   }
00116 
00117   if (!ctx->addr) {
00118     goto err;
00119   }
00120 
00121   do {
00122     rt = connect( ctx->fd, (struct sockaddr *) ctx->addr, ctx->addr_size );
00123   } while( rt == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00124 
00125   if (rt == -1) {
00126 
00127 
00128 #if 0
00129      if (errno != EINPROGRESS) {
00130         if (ctx->verbose) {
00131           fprintf(stderr,"Connect syscall failed. %d\n", errno );
00132         }
00133         goto err;
00134      }
00135 #endif
00136 
00137      FD_ZERO(&wset);
00138      FD_SET(ctx->fd,&wset);
00139      eset = wset;
00140 
00141      tv.tv_sec = connect_timeout;
00142      tv.tv_usec = 0;
00143 
00144      do {
00145        rt = select( ctx->fd + 1, 0, &wset, &eset, &tv ); 
00146      } while( rt == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00147      
00148      if (rt <= 0) {
00149         if (ctx->verbose) {
00150           fprintf(stderr,"Connect timed out. %d\n", errno );
00151         }
00152         goto err;
00153      }
00154 
00155      if (FD_ISSET( ctx->fd, &wset) ||  FD_ISSET( ctx->fd, &eset)) {
00156        len = sizeof(error);
00157        error = 0;
00158        if (getsockopt( ctx->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_ERROR, &error, (socklen_t *) &len ) || error) {
00159          if (ctx->verbose) {
00160            fprintf(stderr,"Connect socket error. %d errno %d\n", error, errno );
00161          }
00162          goto err;
00163        }
00164      }
00165 
00166      if (! FD_ISSET( ctx->fd, &wset)) {
00167          if (ctx->verbose) {
00168            fprintf(stderr,"Still not connected. errno %d\n", errno );
00169          }
00170          goto err;
00171      }
00172   }
00173 
00174 
00175   ctx->connected = 1;
00176   return 0;
00177 
00178 err:
00179   SOCK_close(ctx);
00180   return -1;
00181 }

00184 int SOCK_recv_all( SOCKCTX *ctx, char *msg, size_t length, int read_timeout )
00185 {
00186   size_t pos;
00187   int rt;
00188 
00189 
00190   for(pos = 0; pos < length; ) {
00191       rt = SOCK_recv( ctx, msg, length, read_timeout );
00192       if (rt <= 0) {
00193         return -1;
00194       }
00195       pos += rt;
00196   }
00197   return 0;
00198 }

00201 int SOCK_recv( SOCKCTX *ctx, char *msg, size_t length, int read_timeout )
00202 {
00203   int rt;
00204   fd_set rset;
00205   struct timeval tv;
00206      
00207 retry:
00208      do {
00209        rt = recv( ctx->fd, msg, length, 0 );
00210      } while( rt == -1 && errno == EINTR );
00211 
00212      if (rt == -1) {
00213           
00214         if (errno != EAGAIN) {
00215            if (ctx->verbose) {
00216              fprintf(stderr,"recv failed errno %d\n", errno );
00217            }
00218            goto err;
00219         }
00220 
00221         FD_ZERO(&rset);
00222         FD_SET(ctx->fd,&rset);
00223 
00224         tv.tv_sec = read_timeout;
00225         tv.tv_usec = 0;
00226 
00227         do {
00228           rt = select( ctx->fd + 1, &rset, 0, 0, &tv ); 
00229         } while( rt == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00230         
00231 
00232         if (rt == -1) {
00233           if (ctx->verbose) {
00234             fprintf(stderr, "select failed. %d\n", errno );
00235           }
00236         }
00237      
00238         if (rt == 0) {
00239            if (ctx->verbose) {
00240              fprintf(stderr,"read timed out\n" );
00241            }
00242            goto err;
00243         }
00244 
00245         if (rt == 1) {
00246            goto retry;
00247         }
00248 
00249      }
00250 
00251    if (rt == 0 && ctx->close_on_peer_close  ) {
00252       SOCK_close( ctx );
00253    }
00254    return rt;
00255 
00256 err:
00257    return -1;
00258 }

00261 int SOCK_send( SOCKCTX *ctx, void *bmsg, size_t length, int write_timeout )
00262 {
00263   int rt;
00264   size_t pos;
00265   fd_set wset;
00266   struct timeval tv;
00267   char *msg = bmsg;
00268 
00269   for( pos = 0; pos < length; ) {
00270 
00271      do {
00272        rt = send( ctx->fd, msg + pos, length - pos, 0 );
00273      } while( rt == -1 && errno == EINTR );
00274 
00275      if (rt == -1) {
00276           
00277         if (errno != EAGAIN) {
00278            if (ctx->verbose) {
00279              fprintf(stderr,"send failed errno %d\n", errno );
00280            }
00281            goto err;
00282         }
00283 
00284         FD_ZERO(&wset);
00285         FD_SET(ctx->fd,&wset);
00286 
00287         tv.tv_sec = write_timeout;
00288         tv.tv_usec = 0;
00289 
00290         do {
00291           rt = select( ctx->fd + 1, 0, &wset, 0, &tv ); 
00292         } while( rt == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00293         
00294 
00295         if (rt == -1) {
00296           if (ctx->verbose) {
00297             fprintf(stderr, "select failed. %d\n", errno );
00298           }
00299         }
00300      
00301         if (rt == 0) {
00302            if (ctx->verbose) {
00303              fprintf(stderr,"send timed out\n" );
00304            }
00305            goto err;
00306         }
00307 
00308      }
00309 
00310      pos += rt;
00311    }
00312    return 0;
00313 
00314 err:
00315    return -1;
00316 }        
00317 
00318 int SOCK_close( SOCKCTX *ctx )
00319 {
00320   if (ctx->fd != -1) {
00321     if (close(ctx->fd)) {
00322       if (ctx->verbose) {
00323          fprintf(stderr,"Close failed errno %d\n", errno);
00324       }
00325     }
00326     ctx->fd = -1;
00327     ctx->connected = 0;
00328   }
00329   return 0;
00330 }
00331 
00332 int SOCK_close_with_reset( SOCKCTX *ctx )
00333 {
00334   struct linger l;
00335   
00336   l.l_onoff = 1; l.l_linger = 0;
00337 
00338   if (setsockopt( ctx->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_LINGER, &l, sizeof(struct linger) )) {
00339       if (ctx->verbose) {
00340        fprintf(stderr,"Failed to set linger option. %d\n", errno );
00341       }
00342   }
00343 
00344   return SOCK_close( ctx );
00345 }
